Subject: How to go about TDDing a doclet class?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=74507428
X-Yahoo-Profile: harald_m_mueller

Hi -

[I confess I didn't read or search for any information about the question
above - I'll do that on the weekend.
The reason I jumped to the mailing list is that 2 of us want to write a
doclet *a few hours from now*, and we want to do TDD ... maybe someone here
is kind enough to shoot a quick answer at me ...]

The problem/question is: How do you go about writing a class that is deeply
embedded in a framework (in this case, a doclet in javadoc)? 
From the first line, the code will consist of lines accessing the huge
RootDoc data structure created by javadoc and passed into the doclet's start
method (public static boolean start(RootDoc root)). How do I JUnit and,
especially, TDD this?

Thx, if you have time for a quick answer!

Regards
Harald M. Mueller
